ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder<T> Class

In this Article

The builder for read only collection.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder<T> : System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<T>, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T>, System.Collections.Generic.IList<T>, System.Collections.IList

Type Parameters

T

The type of the collection element.

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder<T>

Inherited Members

,
Equals(Object,Object)
,

,

,

,

Constructors summary

ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder<T>()

Constructs a ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder.
ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder<T>(IEnumerable<T>)

Constructs a ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder, copying contents of the given collection.
ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder<T>(Int32)

Constructs a ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder with a given initial capacity. The contents are empty but builder will have reserved room for the given number of elements before any reallocations are required.

Properties summary

Capacity

Gets and sets the capacity of this ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder.
Count

Returns number of elements in the ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder.
Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the element at the specified index.

Methods summary

Adds an item to the stem.Runtime.CompilerServices.ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder`1.
Clear()

Removes all items from the stem.Runtime.CompilerServices.ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder`1.
Contains(T)

Determines whether the stem.Runtime.CompilerServices.ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder`1 contains a specific value
CopyTo(T[],Int32)

Copies the elements of the stem.Runtime.CompilerServices.ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder`1 to an Array, starting at particular Array index.
GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
IndexOf(T)

Returns the index of the first occurrence of a given value in the builder.
Insert(Int32,T)

Inserts an item to the stem.Runtime.CompilerServices.ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder`1 at the specified index.
Remove(T)

Removes the first occurrence of a specific object from the stem.Runtime.CompilerServices.ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder`1.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the stem.Runtime.CompilerServices.ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder`1 item at the specified index.
Reverse()

Reverses the order of the elements in the entire stem.Runtime.CompilerServices.ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder`1.
Reverse(Int32,Int32)

Reverses the order of the elements in the specified range.
ToArray()

Copies the elements of the stem.Runtime.CompilerServices.ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder`1 to a new array.
ToReadOnlyCollection()

Creates a stem.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1 containing all of the elements of the stem.Runtime.CompilerServices.ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder`1, avoiding copying the elements to the new array if possible. Resets the stem.Runtime.CompilerServices.ReadOnlyCollectionBuilder`1 after the stem.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1 has been created.

ICollection<T>.IsReadOnly

Gets a value indicating whether the stem.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1 is read-only.

Copies the elements of the stem.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1 to an array, starting at the specified array index.
ICollection.IsSynchronized

Gets a value indicating whether access to the ICollection is synchronized (thread safe).
ICollection.SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the ICollection.

Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.

Gets a value indicating whether the IList has a fixed size.

Gets a value indicating whether the IList is read-only.

Gets or sets the element at the specified index.

Removes the first occurrence of a specific object from the IList.

    Gets a value indicating whether the stem.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1 is read-only.

    bool System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<T>.IsReadOnly { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1 is read-only; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created.
